meanings.definition: A party or celebration to mark the moving into a new home.
meanings.sent1: We had a housewarming last night to celebrate our new home.
meanings.sent2: The housewarming was filled with laughter and joy as friends gathered to welcome us.
meanings.sent3: At the housewarming, the cake accidentally caught on fire, adding some unexpected warmth to the celebration.
meanings.sent4: The housewarming felt like a cozy blanket wrapping around us, bringing comfort and happiness.
meanings.sent5: The housewarming was a memorable event, marking the beginning of new memories in our house.

meanings.definition: The act of warming a new house or home.
meanings.sent1: The housewarming of the old cabin involved lighting up the fireplace for the first time in years.
meanings.sent2: During the housewarming of the cottage, the sun streamed in through the windows, warming up the rooms.
meanings.sent3: The housewarming of the igloo required many hands to rub the icy walls to create some heat inside.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the housewarming of the tent began, with everyone huddling closer for warmth.
meanings.sent5: The housewarming of the log cabin was a slow process, but eventually, the chill dissipated, and it felt like home.
